reviews.review_msg: It was Dan's first time teaching during Spring of 2010 and he did a great job! He is very passionate about what he does (especially about glaciers) and the field trip was a blast! Taking good class room notes is key - do this and you can expect a very good mark. On that note, text book was a pain to read and was pretty much useless.

Dan is AMAZING! I'd say he's my favourite prof! Super interested in this class, and extremely approachable and helpful! Email him or go to his office hours. Notes are posted online, so just taking down some important points then going back to the slides is okay. Labs are hard at first but the TA's help a lot. And best field trip and class ever!

As it was Dan's first time teaching the course, it was a bit rough around the edges. While he is passionate and very knowledgeable, his over-use of slides in lecture is distracting and time consuming. He is, however, very willing to lend students help and explain difficult concepts. I'm sure he will improve very much with experience!

weekly labs assignments are okay. they tend to be tedious but achievable. Dan is a good teacher, showing high interest in the subject and deliver his materials crisply. The Midterm was fair but Final Exam was Extremely Difficult, requires thorough reading n understanding of subject

Dan is a nice guy, but the labs for this class were KILLER! They took so much time and they are designed so that you need to ask for help to get them done. There is a mandatory weekend field trip for this course.
